Others: Indian Cricket Team Schedule 2023 is released and they have a jam-packed schedule throughout the whole year with multiple Tests, ODIs & T20Is lined-up for them.
They will be a part of 6 bilateral series and 2 international tournaments.
India will first face the Sri Lankan team in 2023. Sri Lanka will tour the Indian subcontinent for a three-match T20I series and then, a three-match ODI series.
The matches will take place in six different locations across India and the tour will stretch from January to February.
India will play four Test matches and three ODI matches against the mighty Australian team.
The Test matches will be vital for the Indian team as they need to win five out of the six remaining Test matches if they want to qualify for the World Test Championship finals.
India will tour the West Indies for 2 Test matches, 3 ODIs and 3 T20Is against the Caribbeans.
A second string Indian cricket team is most likely to take part in the tour, with the main players resting and preparing for the upcoming Asia cup.
India will play 3 ODI matches, a few days before the quadrennial tournament.
From 26 October to 26 November, the 2023 ICC Cricket World Cup will occur in the subcontinent.

A total of ten teams, 7 qualified through the 2020-23 ICC Cricket World Cup Super League, 2 from the 2023 Cricket World Cup Qualifier and India already qualified due to them being the host nation, will participate in the tournament.
The tournament will occur in a round-robin format, with all the teams playing against each other in the group stage.
India will go into the World Cup as the favorites with them having the advantage of playing in home conditions.
They will try to repeat history and gain the glory they achieved in the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup.
At the end of the year, India will tour South Africa for 2 Test, 3 ODI and 3 T20I matches.
Beginning in December, the tour will further extend to the first month of 2024.
